items.title: RBL Bank among 4 F&O stocks with sharp rise in futures open interest
items.description: As of October 16, nine stocks in the NSE F&O pack saw a notable surge in futures open interest, contributing to a total increase of over 11% compared with the previous trade. A significant rise in futures open interest indicates substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts for a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions in the futures market.

items.title: BLS International, Cyient and 3 others close above VWAP, hinting at bullish trend
items.description: On October 16, the closing prices of five stocks in the Nifty500 pack rallied over 1.5% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price), according to StockEdge.com’s technical scan data. A shift above the VWAP suggests a potential bullish trend.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it indicates that the stock closed higher than the average price at which it traded throughout the day, with the average weighted by trading volume. This is often interpreted by traders and investors as a bullish signal, potentially reflecting positive market sentiment.

items.title: Oberoi Realty and 7 other stocks show bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On October 16, eight stocks from the Nifty200 pack that gained over 2% were featured in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from StockEdge.com.An uptrend signal is generated when the RSI value crosses above 50 from below. “RSI trending up” indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) values are rising, suggesting strengthening momentum in a stock’s price. This can point to potential upward movement and may help traders identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Infosys shares in focus after Q2 PAT jumps 13% YoY, ADRs fall 2%
items.description: Infosys reported a 13% YoY increase in net profit to Rs 7,364 crore for Q2 FY26, with revenue rising 9% YoY to Rs 44,490 crore. The IT major also declared an interim dividend of Rs 23 per share and revised its FY26 revenue guidance upwards. Brokerage firm Nuvama maintained a 'Buy' rating, citing strong revenue growth in constant currency terms.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 11 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 11 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 16, 2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: Bharat Dynamics, Axis Bank among 5 stocks that could give 11-32% return
items.description: Brokerages have turned optimistic on select stocks across sectors, highlighting robust growth prospects, strong earnings visibility, and expanding market opportunities.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: Zee Entertainment shares in focus after Q2 PAT plunges 63% YoY, Nuvama revises target downwards
items.description: Zee Entertainment Enterprises announced its second-quarter financial results for FY26. The company saw a significant drop in net profit and revenue. Advertising revenue declined due to reduced spending. Subscription revenue showed growth. Brokerage firm Nuvama revised the stock's target price downwards. Earnings per share estimates were also cut.

items.title: Anantam Highways InvIT IPO: GMP flat ahead of Friday debut despite decent subscription
items.description: Anantam Highways InvIT is set to list today. The grey market shows no premium, suggesting a listing near its issue price. The Rs 400 crore issue saw strong demand, subscribed 5.62 times. Investors are drawn to its stable road projects and yield potential. Proceeds will aid debt repayment. Post-listing performance hinges on yield distribution and financial disclosures.

items.title: Sihora Industries IPO listing today: No GMP buzz ahead of debut
items.description: Sihora Industries' debut on the BSE SME platform is met with a flat grey market premium, indicating a listing near its issue price of Rs 66. The Rs 10.56 crore IPO saw lukewarm investor response, subscribed only 1.27 times overall.

items.title: Shlokka Dyes shares to list today. Check GMP ahead of debut
items.description: Shlokka Dyes is set to list on the BSE SME platform. The grey market suggests a flat debut, with the stock expected to trade near its issue price. The company's Rs 57.79 crore IPO saw muted investor interest. Shlokka Dyes manufactures reactive dyes and pigments for various industries. Its financials show strong growth.

items.title: Last day to buy Tech Mahindra shares before record date for Rs 15 interim dividend. Check all details
items.description: Investors seeking Tech Mahindra's interim dividend must buy shares by today, October 17. The company declared a dividend of Rs 15 per share. Eligibility is determined by the record date of October 21, 2025. The dividend payment is scheduled for November 12, 2025. Rama Phosphates also offers an interim dividend with a similar ex-dividend date.

items.title: SK Minerals IPO: Grey market signals 4% gain ahead of Friday listing
items.description: SK Minerals and Additives is set to list on the BSE SME platform on Friday. The stock shows a 4% grey market premium, suggesting a mild listing gain. The company's IPO saw decent investor participation, with strong demand from non-institutional investors. SK Minerals manufactures industrial minerals and specialty chemicals.

items.title: Asian shares dip after credit woes hit Wall Street
items.description: Asian shares declined Friday as US bank bad loans and credit market concerns dampened investor sentiment. Gold and silver hit record highs amid US economic fears and US-China tensions. The Bank of Japan signaled continued tightening, while the White House is set to ease auto tariffs.

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 25 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equities surged on Thursday, with Nifty advancing 262 points, driven by expectations of a domestic earnings rebound and renewed foreign inflows. The broad-based rally was supported by strong Q2 results and improving sentiment, with analysts anticipating further upward movement as the earnings season progresses.

items.title: Stocks in news: RIL, Infosys, Wipro, Jio Financial, Tata Steel
items.description: Indian markets saw a strong rally on Thursday, with the Nifty 50 surpassing 25,600, driven by domestic earnings recovery optimism and positive global cues. Key companies like RIL, Infosys, and Wipro reported their second-quarter results, influencing trading activity. Analysts suggest a "buy on dips" strategy amidst sectoral rotation.

items.title: Fitch upgrades outlook on IIFL Finance to positive
items.description: Fitch Ratings has upgraded IIFL Finance's outlook to positive from stable, affirming its 'B+' senior secured debt rating. The agency anticipates improvements in the company's credit profile over the next two years, including asset quality and funding diversity, following the lifting of RBI restrictions on gold loans.

items.title: NSE holidays 2025: Diwali market holiday dates, BSE trading schedule & Muhurat trading timings
items.description: Diwali 2025 sees BSE and NSE closed on 21-22 October, with a one-hour afternoon Muhurat Trading session marking Samvat 2082’s start, symbolising optimism and festive market participation.

items.title: Eternal share price targets raised up to Rs 480. Were Q2 results good or bad?
items.description: Eternal's shares dipped despite brokerages raising targets. Analysts are optimistic about long-term growth in food delivery and quick commerce, citing strong revenue compounding and margin improvements. While some see short-term investor disappointment, others highlight Blinkit's market share gains and unit economics, even with increased spending.

items.title: Nestle India among 4 stocks showing bullish candlestick pattern
items.description: On October 16, among NSE-listed stocks with a market cap above Rs 10,000 crore, four stocks appeared on the bullish "White Marubozu" scanner, according to StockEdge.com’s technical scan data.A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis, occurring when the opening price is the lowest of the period and the closing price is the highest. Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders often interpret it as a signal that buyers controlled the market from open to close, using the pattern to make informed decisions on potential future price movements.Stocks forming White Marubozu on October 16:

items.title: Adani Power shares gain 4% on approval for Godda plant grid connection project buzz
items.description: Adani Power shares surged after receiving government approval to connect its Godda plant to the Indian grid, enabling domestic supply beyond Bangladesh. The company also formed a joint venture for a Bhutanese hydroelectric project. Despite a dip in Q1 profit, analysts remain optimistic about its significant capacity expansion plans.

items.title: Ola Electric shares rise over 15% in 3 sessions. What’s fuelling the rally?
items.description: Shares of Ola Electric rose nearly 5% to Rs 57.80 after the EV maker launched Ola Shakti, its entry into the energy storage business. The portable battery system powers home appliances and small businesses, with four configurations priced between Rs 29,999 and Rs 1,59,999. The company expects BESS demand to surpass automotive battery consumption in the coming years.

items.title: BOJ Governor Ueda hints at possible October rate hike
items.description: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said the central bank will scrutinise various data, including insights from his Washington visit, to decide whether to raise interest rates in October. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Canara HSBC Life shares list flat at Rs 106 on BSE, NSE
items.description: Canara HSBC Life shares: Canara HSBC Life Insurance debuted flat on exchanges at Rs 106 per share, following a Rs 2,517 crore offer for sale. The IPO saw strong demand from institutional investors, while retail and HNI participation was limited. The company's reliance on bancassurance and its valuation are key points for investors as trading begins.

items.title: Fed’s Kashkari: Labor market risks higher than inflation spike
items.description: Minneapolis Fed President Neel Kashkari said he sees a low risk of a sharp decline in the labour market or a sudden surge in inflation. He noted that, between the two, there is “more risk of a labour market negative surprise than a big uptick in inflation.” (Source: Reuters)

items.title: IIFL Finance shares in focus as Fitch revises outlook to positive
items.description: IIFL Finance shares are expected to be in focus after Fitch Ratings revised the company’s long-term outlook to positive from stable, citing expectations of stronger fundamentals and stabilised asset quality. The revision follows the lifting of RBI restrictions on its gold loan business, signalling a steady recovery and improving credit profile.

items.title: Dovish RBI policy spurs corporate bond issuances
items.description: A decline in corporate bond yields in the secondary market has encouraged state-run firms to raise substantial funds. Together, three companies plan to raise around Rs 77.5 billion (USD 880.5 million) in bond sales, driven by expectations of continued support from a dovish monetary policy. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Vikram Solar shares in focus as Q2 net profit rockets 1,636% to Rs 128 crore
items.description: Vikram Solar reported stellar Q2 FY26 results, with net profit soaring 1,636.5% year-on-year to Rs 128 crore and EBITDA rising 226% to Rs 225 crore. Revenue grew 9% to Rs 1,110 crore, while margins expanded sharply. The company expects policy support, GST cuts, and green hydrogen demand to drive future growth.

items.title: Waaree Energies shares in focus as Q2 net profit more than doubles to Rs 842 crore
items.description: Waaree Energies reported a significant 133% surge in net profit to Rs 842 crore for the September quarter, fueled by a 70% revenue jump to Rs 6,066 crore. This strong performance comes amidst a U.S. probe into allegations of circumventing tariffs on Chinese solar components. The company also announced an interim dividend of Rs 2 per share.

items.title: Sensex adds 97 pts, Nifty above 25,600 as D-St extends gains to day 3
items.description: Indian stocks bounced back on Friday, continuing a three-day rally. Gains were seen despite early losses in IT stocks like Infosys and Wipro. Optimism over corporate earnings and steady foreign investment supported the market. Broader markets showed mixed performance. Global markets experienced declines, with Asian shares falling. Gold reached a new record high.

items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Motilal Oswal maintain sell on Wipro; retains buy on LTIMindtree post Q2 results
items.description: Brokerages show mixed views this earnings season — Motilal Oswal stays bullish on LTIMindtree, bearish on Wipro, while Morgan Stanley backs HPCL on strong refining margins and steady demand.

items.title: 10 Diwali 2025 stock picks from Motilal Oswal that could rally up to 38%
items.description: As India steps into Samvat 2082, Motilal Oswal notes that the economy is entering a new growth phase supported by fiscal and monetary tailwinds, pointing to a 100-basis-point repo rate cut, liquidity infusion, and GST 2.0 as catalysts reviving consumption and private capex. Against this backdrop, it has identified 10 stocks poised to benefit from India’s domestic growth revival across banking, manufacturing, consumption, and digital themes.

items.title: LTIMindtree shares in focus after Q2 PAT rises 12% YoY. Should you buy now?
items.description: LTIMindtree posted a 12% YoY rise in Q2 FY26 PAT to Rs 1,401 crore, driven by steady business momentum and cost optimizations. Revenue grew 10% YoY to Rs 10,394 crore. Brokerages Nuvama and Motilal Oswal maintained ‘Buy’ ratings, citing strong constant-currency growth, expanding EBIT margins, and robust total contract value, while projecting continued growth in H2 FY26.

items.title: Asian Paints surges nearly 5%, extends rally to third consecutive day
items.description: Asian Paints shares surged, hitting a new intraday peak as investor confidence remains strong. The company's international expansion, marked by its new UAE white cement facility, is a key driver. Investors are anticipating Q2 FY2026 earnings and a potential interim dividend, with analysts maintaining a positive outlook and a target price of Rs 2,650.

items.title: European stocks set to wipe out weekly gains as banks plunge
items.description: European shares tumbled on Friday, on course for their biggest drop in six weeks, as renewed concerns about the health of U.S. regional banks hurt lenders globally.

items.title: Midcap Mayhem: These 10 stocks crash hard in 2025, but offer up to 37% upside
items.description: In 2025, Indian equities have shown a stark contrast: the Sensex has gained 6.8% year-to-date, while the BSE Midcap Index has barely moved, up just 0.25%. Around 82 of 145 midcap stocks posted negative returns.

items.title: F&O Radar| Deploy Short Strangle in Nifty to benefit from Theta decay amid a probable consolidation
items.description: Nifty50 has rallied over 1,000 points since late September, hitting short-term overbought levels. Experts suggest range-bound trading near 25,670–25,750, with support at 25,060–25,250. A Short Strangle strategy in Nifty options can profit from Theta decay during probable consolidation.

items.title: Whirlpool of India shares jump 10% after signing key brand, tech agreements. Check details
items.description: Whirlpool of India shares rose sharply on Friday after the company announced signing key brand, technology, and service agreements with Whirlpool Corporation and affiliates. The deals aim to strengthen long-term growth, innovation, and exclusive brand rights, ensuring smooth operations and continued support from its parent company.

items.title: Japanese shares fall as banks track US peers lower, yen gains also weigh
items.description: Japanese stocks experienced a downturn on Friday. Bank shares declined amid concerns over credit issues at American regional banks. A strengthening yen also impacted market sentiment. The Nikkei index saw a notable drop, reflecting investor anxiety. This market movement follows a week of volatility influenced by political developments and fears of an overheated market.

items.title: After Rs 2 lakh crore selloff, FIIs are set for a comeback. Elara Capital lists 4 reasons
items.description: Elara Capital sees a potential FII turnaround in Indian equities, driven by under-ownership, narrowing valuation premiums, mid-cap resilience, GST cuts, and strong macro conditions, supporting gradual reallocation and domestic leadership.

items.title: Diwali rally lifts Nifty to fresh 52-week high. 8 factors driving today’s boom
items.description: Nifty today: The Nifty 50 reached a new 52-week high above 25,700, driven by returning foreign inflows, easing U.S. bond yields, and a stronger rupee. Festive optimism and fading IPO pressure also contributed to the rally, with short covering further amplifying upside momentum.

items.title: Nifty Bank hits fresh all-time high. Is this the start of Diwali dhamaka?
items.description: Nifty Bank hit an all-time high of 57,651.30 on Friday, rallying around 10,000 points from its March 2025 lows and surpassing its previous peak of 57,628.40. Led by HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank, the 12-stock index gained 229 points in the morning session. So far in 2025, Nifty Bank has outperformed the broader Nifty, rising over 13%.

items.title: Strong order flow, margin improvement to support Persistent’s growth
items.description: Persistent Systems’ stock jumped 8% after reporting robust Q2 results, including sequential revenue growth, 16.3% operating margin, record $609.2 million order bookings, and a healthcare recovery driving FY26 growth.

items.title: Nestle India, SBI among 7 stocks that hit 52-week highs and gained up to 12% in a month
items.description: On Friday, the benchmark Sensex climbed by around 485 points to close at 83,952. During the rally, six stocks from the BSE 200 Index hit their 52-week highs — marking their highest levels in the past year. Such breakouts are often seen by traders and investors as bullish signals, suggesting strong upward momentum and the potential for further gains.

items.title: Stock Radar: Range breakout after 6-month consolidation to hit fresh highs in October 2025; Time to buy or book profits?
items.description: Bajaj Finance stock has achieved a significant breakout from a six-month consolidation pattern on monthly charts, reaching new record highs. Experts suggest this upward trend may continue. Short-term traders are advised to consider buying the stock for potential gains above 1100 levels in the coming weeks. The stock is showing strong upward momentum, trading above key moving averages.

items.title: Dhanteras 2025: 8 Nifty microcaps stocks doubled investors’ money since last year!
items.description: As the nation gears up for the radiant festival of Dhanteras on 18 October 2025, investors have another reason to celebrate—beyond gold and prosperity rituals. Eight Nifty Microcap 250 stocks stood out by more than doubling the money of investors who bought them on the last Dhanteras, 29 October 2024. With the stock market’s festive cheer in full swing, these microcap multibaggers have delivered stellar returns ranging from 100% to a staggering 195% in just under a year. However, it is important to keep in mind that past returns do not guarantee future performance. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Adani Power,  Infosys among 6 stocks that saw top action today
Yes Bank shares sink nearly 5% after Japan's SMBC denies buying more shares
items.description: Shares of Yes Bank dropped nearly 5% to Rs 22.05 after SMBC clarified it has no immediate plans to raise its stake beyond 24.99%. SMBC’s India head Rajeev Kannan said the bank will focus on contributing to Yes Bank’s board as its largest shareholder and will not take on an executive role, citing ongoing areas the bank needs to address.

items.title: Vijay Kedia reshuffles Rs 1,290 crore portfolio with a new bet, 1 top-up, 1 trim. Here’s what Q2 trades reveal
items.description: Ace investor Vijay Kedia reshuffled his Rs 1,292.5 crore portfolio in Q2 FY26, adding Yatharth Hospital, increasing his stake in Global Vectra, and trimming Affordable Robotic & Automation. Yatharth shows strong technicals and robust Q2 growth, Global Vectra faces a downtrend but long-term returns remain solid, while Affordable Robotic rebounds post-Q2 results despite lingering technical weakness.

items.title: Sebi mulls measures to ease dematerialise & transfer physical shares
items.description: Markets regulator Sebi on Friday proposed measures to make it easier for investors to dematerialise physical shares and transfer them, especially those lodged before April 1, 2019.

items.title: For investors with ability to invest for the medium term: 5 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with upside potential up to 35%
items.description: For all those who are now turning bullish, a small reminder: Mid-cap stocks have been in correction mode for the last one year. If you look at their long-term track record, such corrections do happen at regular intervals. So, be ready to face them… and also ignore them. Having said that, our base case assumption is that the markets are likely to trade with bullish bias in the near future. The whole point as one moves forward would be to look at what you are buying and why. Just to put this in perspective: Which stock should one pick up in the banking sector? The criteria for that choice has to be very different from when you pick a stock in the infrastructure space. So, choose the right yardstick.

items.title: Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and return potential of more than 24% in 1 year
items.description: As the market turns more bullish, it is important to follow a standard operating procedure: Look at how the company has performed in the Q2 earnings season. More importantly, look at the management commentary and compare it with what was said in Q1. If they are again giving excuses for not delivering, it is probably time to move out. If they are not delivering but are transparent about why they have not been able to deliver, it may be worth waiting. Our selected stocks for today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score which is based on five key pillars: Earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.
